full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 120 of 236 LC3KMAX4 Parkinson - Direct 1 Q. What do we see here? 2 A. This is actually the very front of the house. You're standing to the northwest, looking to the southeast. MS. COMEY: We can take this down. Thank you, Ms. Drescher. Q. Mr. Parkinson, what was your role in the search on October 20, 2005, at 358 El Brillo Way? A. On that morning, my role was to record the reading of the search warrant, and also to do a very quick search of the residence to see if there was any other persons in there, for officer safety purposes, and then to supervise, if necessary, and also participate in evidence collection, should that be necessary. Q. Who else from the Palm Beach Police Department do you remember participating in the October 20, 2005, search? A. There were a number of people. The main one was Detective Joseph Recarey, now deceased, Sergeant Mike Dawson was present. Q. Were there others whose names aren't coming to mind right now? A. Detective Sandman was present. Q. And Mr. Parkinson, without going through the rest, were there other members of the Palm Beach Police Department there? A. There were. Q. You mentioned doing a protective sweep of the house. During that sweep, who, if anyone, did you see in the SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00012634
